required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics And Relative Bioavailability Of Bococizumab (PF-04950615; RN316) When Administered To The Abdomen, Thigh Or Upper Arm
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-label, Randomized, Single Dose, Parallel Group Study To Assess Injection Site Relative Bioavailability Of Pf-04950615 Following Subcutaneous Administration In Adult Subjects With Hypercholesterolemia

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to characterize the single dose pharmacokinetics of PF-04950616 following subcutaneous injection to the abdomen, upper arm or the thigh.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0 - inf)]
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - inf). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - inf).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)
A measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from blood divided by bioavailability

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: The time to reach maximum observed plasma concentration
A theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug is uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration divided by bioavailability
The time measured for the terminal plasma concentration to decrease by one half

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the LDL-C effect curve
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the LDL-C effect curve from time 0 to the last timepoint with measurable effect

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum LDL-C lowering
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach the maximum LDL-C lowering

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the abdomen
Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the upper arm
Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the thigh

intervention.description: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered SC to the abdomen
intervention.arm_group_label: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the abdomen

intervention.description: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered SC to the upper arm
intervention.arm_group_label: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the upper arm

intervention.description: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered SC to the thigh
intervention.arm_group_label: Single 150 mg PF-04950615 dose administered to the thigh

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects 18 to 65 years of age.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) â‰¤ 33 kg/m2, and total body weight of 60 kg to 90 kg (132 lbs to 198 lbs).
- Fasting LDL-C must be > 130 mg/dL (borderline high per NCEP ATP III criteria) at two qualifying visits: initial screening (Days -28 to -14) and Day -7.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poorly controlled type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus (HbA1c > 9.0%).
- History of a cardiovascular or cerebrovascular event (eg, MI, stroke, TIA) or related procedure (eg, angioplasty) during the past year.
- Subjects who meet the New York Heart Association (NYHA) criteria for congestive heart failure (CHF) classes III or IV.
